moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 a6: The main line here is 5...Bc5.  This is the secondary line, and it is not as good for Black as the main line...
moves.14. Rac1 b6 15. Bg5: Other moves that have been played more often here include 15. b3, Bb1, and Qe3.  It appears we are now out of book...
This move gives White a very powerful and very influential passed b-pawn...
moves.27. Rd4 Qb2 28. Na4 Qxa2 29. Nxb6 Qb2 30: Conversely, White's queen foray deep into queenside penetration bears much more fruit than Black's fruitless queen foray...
moves.36... Rdg8 37. Rd2 Qa8: This move gives White the d6 pawn, and Black does not get enough compensation for it by capturing the g2 pawn, due to White's subsequently powerful centralized queen...
moves.38. Nxd6 Bxd6 39. Rxd6 Rg6xg2 40. Qd4+ e: So now White is a pawn up with a beautifully centralized queen that is exerting much discomfort upon Black's position...
moves.41... Rg2g7 42. Kf2 Qa3 43. Rc3 Qa1: Black's queen never was able to exert any influence on White's queenside, despite repeated attempts...
moves.44. Rd1 Qa7+ 45. Rc5 Rc8 46. Rdc1 Qb6 47: This loses quickly, but Black was lost anyways...
moves.51... Qd8 52. Rd4: The end begins with some very sick rook moves...
